text.p: Following is a summary of expected major new issues in the international primary debt market.
The list was compiled from information provided by borrowers, banks mandated to lead manage the issues and other primary market sources. All terms and conditions are indicative.
Details of upcoming bond issues can be telephoned into the London newsroom on +44 171 542 7658
(OFFICIAL indicates confirmed by borrower)
* * * DOLLARS
SAKURA BANK, $600 million perpetual FRN, step-up and call after five years, Libor plus 90 b.p. initially, Merrill Lynch/Sakura, week of August 18
* * * STERLING
CITY MORTGAGE RECEIVABLES 7 PLC, 76 million stg mortgage-backed notes, Greenwich Capital Markets
STUDENT LOAN sell-off, 1.6 billion stg, completion expected in February 1998, N M Rothschild advising government
* * * FRANCS
Several Japanese names said to be eyeing sector, including government-guaranteed entities, unlikely until September/October
* * * GUILDERS
FRANKFURT HYPO, seen eyeing pfandbrief issue
* * * MARKS
CENTRAL EUROPEAN MEDIA ENTERPRISES, 100 million mark seven-year junk bond, and also $100 million tranche, both +300-325 bp, Morgan Stanley, August 14
GERMAN LANDER, said to be planning third Lander jumbo deal
AFRICAN DEVELOPMENT BANK, eyeing mark deal in Q4
KFW, 2-3 billion mark FRN, after August holiday
* * * RAND
AFRICAN DEVELOPMENT BANK, up to 150 million rand in Q4
